instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message: So I have yet another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that posts to flashing ? has <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> but PPBUS is 8.18V. WHat the heck is going on here? This board has been messed with by someone else a little.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message:
If you get flashing "?" sign, do not bother with power on sequence anymore.
You may have SSD issue, bad traces/connector, APFS issue...

SSD problem is not related with wrong <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
I suppose you've posted that voltage without battery connected.
You should check battery bus, for this issue.
May be caused by bad SMC also.
